_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Airgas-Great Lakes, Inc.
2325 Salzburg Road
Midland, MI 48640


Risk Management Plan

Executive Summary

Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies.  The facility complies with Compressed Gas Association and National Fire Protection Association standards applicable to compressed gases.  It is our policy to adhere to applicable federal, state and local laws.  In the event of an emergency, it is our policy to notify the Midland County Fire Department and to request that the fire department respond to the emergency.  

Facility description and regulated substance handled.  The facility manufactures acetylene, which it transports by pipeline for offsite use.  The facility also fills and stores acetylene in cylinders, in a separate staging area, for offsite distribution and sale as a fuel.  Preparation of this Risk Management Plan is timed to coincide with an increase in acetylene production.

General accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific steps.  The facility has established a comprehensive prevention program designed to prevent accidental releases of acetylene, including written process safety information, process hazard analysis, and both passive and active mitigation systems.  The facility complies with the OSHA PSM standard.

Five year accident history.  The facility never has had an accident involving acetylene.  

Emergency response program.  If there is an emergency involving our acetylene system, it is our policy to notify the Midland County Fire Department and request their assistance in responding to the emergency.  The facility has an emergency preparedness/response plan, which has been integrated with the local community emergency response plan.  Each of our employees has received special training in these procedures. 

Planned changes to improve safety.  Although there are no planned changes, we conduct periodic facility evaluations to ensure the maintenance of safe conditions.  Safety improvement is on-going at the
